alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 10:46AM CDT until June 29 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hancock County in west central Illinois... Henderson County in west central Illinois... Warren County in west central Illinois... McDonough County in west central Illinois... Southern Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... Lee County in southeastern Iowa... Southeastern Clark County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1045 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stephenson Park to Carthage to near Mendon, moving east at 55 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR CARTHAGE AND MOVING INTO MACOMB ILLINOIS. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Carthage, Ferris, Burnside, Adrian and Bentley around 1050 AM CDT. Fountain Green, Webster, Welter Recreation Area and Augusta around 1055 AM CDT. West Burlington, Blandinsville, Bowen, Tennessee, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, Beaverdale and Des Moines County Fairgrounds around 1100 AM CDT. Burlington, Colchester, Augusta, Gulf Port, Starr`s Cave Park and Preserve, Argyle Lake State Park, Hancock County Fairgrounds, Carthage Lake and Burlington Regional Airport around 1105 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Macomb, Good Hope, Sciota, Western Illinois University, Spring Lake, McDonough County 4-H Grounds, Lone Tree, Gladstone, Scottsburg, Macomb Municipal Airport, Bushnell, Biggsville, Bardolph, New Philadelphia, Walnut Grove, Doddsville, Kirkwood, Industry, Prairie City and Prairie City Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
